title: This company doesn't care and bans for no reason.
body:
I was perma banned for inting. https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=B%20is%204%20Bussy Heres my op.gg . Over 200 games. Find one where I was inting. 

This company genuinely doesn't care, I have a capped friendslist and stream. It's a joke that anyone can look at my profile and think i'm inting. I'm a working professional who's a security researcher. I have a degree and am serving this country honorably. Shame on this company, and I ask any of the Riot supporters here to defend this. The game they gave me on the in client card doesn't even work.

The ban code is 2828, which means it's a manual ban by player support. This means a player support agent looked at my profile and decided I was inting enough for a perma.

replies.body:
If you were banned for intentionally feeding, then it would display games in your client when you log in. Please post these linked games and a screenshot of what you get when you log in.

Also, Riot hasn't used "ban codes" since the early part of this decade.

*edit* obviously a troll-bait thread. DFTT guys.

*edit 2* - first death was against camille and he could've won - was it a stupid decision, sure, but it's not like it proves intentional. He then dies to minions after his second fight with the jungler there. He then goes back in, stands near a wall, gets deleted by the camille. He then leaves base, immediately backs while not even to inhibitor, then AFKs intentionally the rest of the game.

For a bronze player, I may be able to look past the deaths. The deaths **all** individually appear slightly suspicious especially for your rank, and together raise quite a bit of suspicion. The lack of any ward placement as well. We can't see in game chat, but how much does anyone want to bet that there was some flaming going on of the jungler for "being late" and getting OP killed?

*edit 3* copying reply from below to the OP for further clarification.

Furthermore, I have determined beyond a reasonable doubt that, while none of your three deaths may themselves have been intentional, that you took specific action to spite other players and in taking such action the result was your death - which is griefing in that you, be it willfully or "in the heat of the moment" intentionally ran back to lane and did something so incredibly stupid that no player at any skill level above complete noob should've done (run straight next to a wall into a Camille).
